newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Blue chips drive Mauritius bourse index down.
newsitem.headline: Blue chips drive Mauritius bourse index down.

text.p: The Mauritius Stock Exchange share index, Semdex, shed 3.37 points to close at 376.31 on Friday on falling prices on blue chip stocks, brokers said.
Turnover was posted at 3.71 million rupees on 132,543 shares from 4.47 million rupees on 203,553 shares on Wednesday.
Brokers said a lot of shares eased during Friday's trading session under the influence of the market's overriding mood of wait-and-see.
State Bank of Mauritius (SBM) fell 40 cents to 12.60 rupees on 20,000 shares and Mauritius Commercial Bank (MCB) lost 1.00 rupee to 88.00 on 9,200 shares.

Sun Resorts eased 10 cents to 47.90 rupees on 3,000 shares, Grand Baie Hotel (GBH) lost 50 cents to 52.50 rupees on 2,730 shares and New Mauritius Hotels (NMH) was stable at 38.00 rupees on 15,000 shares.

Commerce based Rogers was 50 cents down to 91.00 rupees on 1,800 shares, Ireland Blyth Ltd (IBL) was unchanged to 15.40 rupees on 2,000 shares and Happy World Foods (HWF) fell 70 cents to 14.60 rupees on 7,262 shares.
In the sugar sector, Harel Freres lost 1.00 rupee to 54.00 on 10,000 shares and Mon Tresor Mon Desert (MTMD) remained at 38.10 rupees on 2,500 shares.
Investment stocks Promotion And Development (PAD) fell 70 cents to 13.00 rupees on 25,025 shares and United Docks eased 50 cents to 36.00 rupees on 5,400 shares.
Air Mauritius climbed 10 cents to 35.40 rupees on 46 shares.
